content:
"The Crown" is definitely a show that can consume your daily routine, isn't it? With its engaging storylines, stunning production values, and impressive performances, it's easy to get hooked!

15 hours in just two weeks is impressive, though! You're making great progress, and I'm sure you'll finish the season soon. The commute and bedtime viewing routine is a great way to make time for your favorite shows.

Since you've invested so much time in "The Crown," I think you'll appreciate the other period dramas and historical fiction shows I recommended. They share similar themes, settings, and production qualities that made "The Crown" so captivating.

If you don't mind me asking, what do you think it is about "The Crown" that's keeping you so engaged? Is it the characters, the historical events, the costumes and settings, or something else entirely?

Also, do you have a favorite character or storyline in "The Crown" so far?
